title: Constructivist Web-Based Science Learning Design for Enhancing Cognitive Flexibility

context.prior_knowledge: Basic theories in science and foundational data analysis skills
context.additional_context: Learners are office/administrative professionals with advanced expertise in science, participating in blended learning using personal devices. The environment combines real-time collaboration and asynchronous activities.

learning_goals: Achieve a 20% improvement in cognitive flexibility by utilizing multi-representational strategies (problem-based, case studies, visualization tools) that connect various scientific phenomena
Enhance scientific problem-solving skills by interacting with peer learners at least three times via web-based collaborative tools (chat rooms, forums)
Solve complex scientific problems with over 80% participation in a constructivist learning environment (scaffoldings, expert feedback)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
